title: Accumulation of water in a tank

content.question: Water is pumped into a tank at a rate of <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>r</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mo>=</mo> <mn>30</mn> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mrow> <mn>1</mn> <mo>−</mo> <msup> <mi>e</mi> <mrow> <mo>−</mo> <mn>0.16</mn> <mi>t</mi> </mrow> </msup> </mrow> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@488D@</annotation> </semantics> </math> gallons per minute, where t is the number of minutes since the pump was turned on. If the tank contained 800 gallons of water when the pump was turned on, how much water, to the nearest gallon, is in the tank after 20 minutes?

topic.text: 8.3: Using Accumulation Functions and Definite Integrals in Applied Contexts

skill.text: Skill 3.D: Apply an appropriate mathematical definition, theorem, or test.
